t: Mark 8
Four Thousand Fed
In*p those days, when there was again a large crowd and they had nothing to eat, Jesus called His disciples and said to them,
“I*r feel*r compassion*r for*r the*r people*r because*r they*r have*r remained*r with*r Me*r now*r three*r days*r and*r have*r nothing*r to*r eat.*r
If*r I*r send*r them*r away*r hungry*r to*r their*r homes,*r they*r will*r faint*r on*r the*r way;*r and*r some*r of*r them*r have*r come*r from*r a*r great*r distance.”*r
And His disciples answered Him, “Where will anyone be able to*i find*i enough*i bread here in this*i desolate place to satisfy these people?”
And He was asking them, “How*r many*r loaves*r do*r you*r have?”*r And they said, “Seven.”

And He directed the people to sit down on the ground; and taking the seven loaves, He gave thanks and broke them, and started giving them to His disciples to serve to them, and they served them to the people.
They also had a few small fish; and after He had blessed them, He ordered these to be served as well.
And they ate and were satisfied; and they picked up seven large baskets full of what was left over of the broken pieces.
About four thousand were there;*i and He sent them away.
And immediately He entered the boat with His disciples and came to the district of Dalmanutha.
The*p Pharisees came out and began to argue with Him, seeking from Him a sign from heaven, to test Him.
Sighing deeply in His spirit, He said, “Why*r does*r this*r generation*r seek*r for*r a*r sign?*r Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r no*r sign*r will*r be*r given*r to*r this*r generation.”*r
Leaving them, He again embarked and went away to the other side.
And*p they had forgotten to take bread, and did not have more than one loaf in the boat with them.
And He was giving orders to them, saying, “Watch*r out!*r Beware*r of*r the*r leaven*r of*r the*r Pharisees*r and*r the*r leaven*r of*r Herod.”*r
They began*i to discuss with one another the*i fact*i that they had no bread.

And Jesus, aware of this, said to them, “Why*r do*r you*r discuss*r the*ir fact*ir that*r you*r have*r no*r bread?*r Do*r you*r not*r yet*r see*r or*r understand?*r Do*r you*r have*r a*r hardened*r heart?*r
Having*sr eyes,*sr do*sr you*sr not*sr see?*sr And*r having*sr ears,*sr do*sr you*sr not*sr hear?*sr And*r do*r you*r not*r remember,*r
when*r I*r broke*r the*r five*r loaves*r for*r the*r five*r thousand,*r how*r many*r baskets*r full*r of*r broken*r pieces*r you*r picked*r up?”*r They said to Him, “Twelve.”
“When*r I*ir broke*ir the*r seven*r for*r the*r four*r thousand,*r how*r many*r large*r baskets*r full*r of*r broken*r pieces*r did*r you*r pick*r up?”*r And they said to Him, “Seven.”
And He was saying to them, “Do*r you*r not*r yet*r understand?”*r
And*p they came to Bethsaida. And they brought a blind man to Jesus and implored Him to touch him.
Taking the blind man by the hand, He brought him out of the village; and after spitting on his eyes and laying His hands on him, He asked him, “Do*r you*r see*r anything?”*r
And he looked up and said, “I see men, for I see them*i like trees, walking around.”
Then again He laid His hands on his eyes; and he looked intently and was restored, and began*i to see everything clearly.
And He sent him to his home, saying, “Do*r not*r even*r enter*r the*r village.”*r
Peter’s Confession of Christ
Jesus*p went out, along with His disciples, to the villages of Caesarea Philippi; and on the way He questioned His disciples, saying to them, “Who*r do*r people*r say*r that*r I*r am?”*r
They told Him, saying, “John the Baptist; and others say*i Elijah; but others, one of the prophets.”
And He continued*i by questioning them, “But*r who*r do*r you*r say*r that*r I*r am?”*r Peter answered and said to Him, “You are the Christ.”
And He warned them to tell no one about Him.
And*p He began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders and the chief priests and the scribes, and be killed, and after three days rise again.
And He was stating the matter plainly. And Peter took Him aside and began to rebuke Him.
But turning around and seeing His disciples, He rebuked Peter and said, “Get*r behind*r Me,*r Satan;*r for*r you*r are*r not*r setting*r your*r mind*r on*r God’s*r interests,*r but*r man’s.”*r
And*p He summoned the crowd with His disciples, and said to them, “If*r anyone*r wishes*r to*r come*r after*r Me,*r he*r must*r deny*r himself,*r and*r take*r up*r his*r cross*r and*r follow*r Me.*r
For*r whoever*r wishes*r to*r save*r his*r life*r will*r lose*r it,*r but*r whoever*r loses*r his*r life*r for*r My*r sake*r and*r the*r gospel’s*r will*r save*r it.*r
For*r what*r does*r it*r profit*r a*r man*r to*r gain*r the*r whole*r world,*r and*r forfeit*r his*r soul?*r
For*r what*r will*r a*r man*r give*r in*r exchange*r for*r his*r soul?*r

For*r whoever*r is*r ashamed*r of*r Me*r and*r My*r words*r in*r this*r adulterous*r and*r sinful*r generation,*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r will*r also*r be*r ashamed*r of*r him*r when*r He*r comes*r in*r the*r glory*r of*r His*r Father*r with*r the*r holy*r angels.”*r
